intro: Glaucium elbursium, commonly known as the Persian fumitory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces striking yellow flowers that are often surrounded by glandular, hairy structures. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive bluish-green color due to the presence of a waxy coating. Glaucium elbursium is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system.
